nitf
Class FileSource

java.lang.Object
  nitf.NITFObject
      nitf.DestructibleObject
          nitf.BandSource
              nitf.FileSource

public final class FileSource
extends BandSource

FileSource The FileSource class extends the BandSource class, allowing you to provide data from an IOHandle. This class is final because the BandSource class uses special logic when it gets constructed from a subclass. This can however be used as a delegate member inside another specialized BandSource.

Parameters:
address -

FileSource

public FileSource(IOHandle handle,
                  long start,
                  int numBytesPerPixel,
                  int pixelSkip)
           throws NITFException
Constructs and returns a BandSource from a File This is one of the two BandSources the library provides for free. If you want something more detailed to your needs, feel free to extend the BandInfo abstract class.

Parameters:
handle - the source IOHandle
start - the starting offset in the file where data for this band begins
numBytesPerPixel - the number of bytes per pixel this is ignored if pixelSkip == 0
pixelSkip - the number of pixels to skip, that are between pixels of this band. i.e. the number of bands in the data buffer - 1 If this is 0, it signifies a contiguous read.
Throws:
NITFException

                 int size)
          throws NITFException

Reads size bytes from the BandSource, and stores it in the given byte buf

Specified by:
read in class BandSource

size - The number of bytes to read
